intro: Catimbium, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers that resemble small bells, hence its common name. Catimbium typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often have a velvety texture, adding to its ornamental value.
